name: Some Peace of Mind
storyline: You wake up in the middle of the night and you find yourself in your room, but everything feels out of place. It seems like your brother locked your computer, messed with your stuff and left clues all around to help you decrypt the password. But why would he do that? And why does your room seems so weird?
summary:
You wake up in the middle of the night and you find yourself in your room, but everything feels out of place. It seems like your brother locked your computer, messed with your stuff and left clues all around to help you decrypt the password. But why would he do that? And why does your room seems so weird?

Features:
* Inventory and logic based puzzles
* A room full of objects to interact with
* Over 150 scenes, comprising of real photographs carefully shot and retouched to provide a fluid gaming experience
* Over 100 sound effects, plus ambient sounds and original music
* A 90’s classic, 2d first person navigation system with multitouch support
* An enticing story, with or without a plot twist
* Made almost entirely by a single developer (can’t get much more indie than that)

Some Peace Of Mind is a remastered version of the same-titled game released back in 2011 exclusively for PCs, before “escape rooms” were cool. This version was built from the ground up for iPad & iPhone and features many enhancements, including a new story, new ending, new puzzles, new scenes, new inventory items, new music etc.
